de.unistuttgart.vis.wearable.os.activityRecognition

Class NeuralNetwork

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.unistuttgart.vis.wearable.os.activityRecognition.NeuralNetwork

  • public class NeuralNetwork
extends java.lang.Object

    The NeuralNetwork class is a Java API for the neural network developed for GarmentOS.

    The Neural Network needs at least two layer, one for the input and one for the output neurons, otherwise the network can handle an arbitary number of hidden layers with an arbitary number of neurons each (at least 1). The nework creates bias neurons in every hidden layer having a constant impact on the result and subsequent neurons.

    This neural network can be saved to disk for later use. A saved network can be loaded to create a new network. A saved network can not be loaded into an already created network but always creates a new one.

    In comparison to the original C API the Java API also offers some functions for direct classification which is now done by a single Java function call. The training can now also be one in only one function call.

    This class requires the shared neuralnetwork library to be in the same directory as the binary java NeuralNetwork class file. The shared library is loaded statically to use the native functions.

    The C structures (for Java Developers: read instances) are saved in the JNI source file and explicitly identified by the instance id. Since the memory for the structures (instances) are allocated in C they must be explicitly deleted again. Therefore one must call the delete function of this class to free this allocated memory.

    All values, input and output must and will be in range (-1.0 .. 1.0)

    Important:
    Instances that are no longer needed or will never be used again must be explicitly deleted by the user.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    roehrdor

    • Constructor Detail

      • NeuralNetwork

        public NeuralNetwork(int[] topology)
        Create a new Neural Network with the given topology. The topology is an array which size identifies the number of layers in this neura network. On each array index the number of elements in this layer is stored. There must be at least two layers, one for the input and one for the output. If there are less layers in the topology or if there are not more than zero Neuron in any layer an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        topology - the topology that describes the layers of the neural network

      • NeuralNetwork

        public NeuralNetwork(java.lang.String file)
        Loads an existing neural network from the given file. If there is no string passed as argument the constructor throws an IllegalArgumentException.
        Parameters:
        file - the neural network save file to load

    • Method Detail

      • delete

        public void delete()
        Unlike other Java classes this class needs to manually delete its instances. Once done this function shall be called on every created instance, so the allocated memory is freed.

      • input

        public void input(double[] input)
        Update the input for the neural network.
        The input value must be in range (-1.0 .. 1.0)
        Parameters:
        input - the input to feed forward

      • train

        public void train(double[] input,
                  double[] target)
        Train the neural network with the given input and target data.
        This function calls input(double[]) for the input data and backProp(double[]) for the target data.
        The input and target value must be in range (-1.0 .. 1.0)
        Parameters:
        input - the inputs to feed forward
        target - target result

      • backProp

        public void backProp(double[] target)
        Train the network with an already given input.
        The target value must be in range (-1.0 .. 1.0)
        Parameters:
        target - the target value

      • result

        public void result(double[] result)
        Get the result of the neural network classification.
        The output value will be in range (-1.0 .. 1.0)
        Parameters:
        result - result output array to store the results in

      • classifiy

        public void classifiy(double[] input,
                      double[] output)
        Feed forward the input and fetch the output.
        This function calls input(double[]) for the input data and result(double[]) for the output data.
        The input value must be in range (-1.0 .. 1.0).
        The output value will be in range (-1.0 .. 1.0).
        Parameters:
        input - the input to feed forward
        output - the result of the neural network
